location.name: Yerevan
location.activity-description: Strengthen DRR system at all levels.

location.name: Yerevan
location.activity-description: Strengthen DRR system at all levels

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Availability of educational policy on Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) for population 2. Number of Crisis Management Centers decentralized and replicated in the regions of Armenia 3. Level of technical and educational capacities of the CMSA 4. Number of cities that joined City Resilience campaign 5. Number of communities where Local Level Risk Management has been conducted and Community Risk Certificate piloted 6. Availability of Information Technologies solution for the Disaster Risk Management 7. Availability of Disaster Risk Reduction strategy and Action Plan for 2016-2020 through Disaster Risk Reduction National Platform (DRR National Platform) 8. Availability of Minimum Initial Service training package integrated into disaster management framework

baseline.comment: 1. None (2013) 2. 0 (2014) 3. Not available- technical and educational capacities at the Crisis Management State Academy CMSA (2013) 4. 3 (2013) 5. 12 (2013) 6. Not available (2014) 7. Lack of required capacities (2013) 8. Not available (2013)

target.comment: 1.DRR Education concept note developed 2. 1 3. Dispatchers' training center established and "Making City's Resilient" training package mainstreamed into curriculum of CMSA 4. 6 5. 12 6. Negotiations with stakeholders held 7. DRR Strategy and Hyogo Framework for Action (HFA) implemented at all levels 8.Minimum Initial Service training package integrated into Disaster Risk Management of retraining curriculum of DRRNP

actual.comment: 1.Available 2.1 3. Available-Dispatchers' training center established and "Making City's Resilient" training package mainstreamed into curriculum CMSA 4.10 5.12 6. Partially-Working group on Smart City Concept formed in the Municipality of Yerevan 7.Partially-The Concept paper of Rescue Volunteers adopted by the Government and HFA strategy will be completed in 2015 8.Partially-Check-list on country situation assessment conducted

target.comment: 1. Concept on DRR Education of Population approved 2. 8 3. Renovation of the premises of CMSA completed, bio-safety class established and provided with transportation means 4. 3 5. Not applicable due to insufficient funding 6. Draft of Smart city concept for Yerevan city and cellphone application of early warning system developed 7. Disaster Risk Reduction Strategy update based on Sendai Framework for action (SFA) initiated 8. Minimum Initial Service training package integrated into CMSA retraining curriculum

actual.comment: 1. Available-Concept on DRR Education of Population approved by the Government 2. 8 3. Available-Two training packages integrated into curriculum, renovation of premises completed, transportation means provided and mobile bio-safety class established 4. 3 5. Not applicable 6. Partially-The draft of the Smart city concept for Yerevan and mobile application of early warning system developed and presented to the Government 7. Partially-Thematic working group within DRR National Platform formed and Working plan for updating DRR National Strategy based on SFA developed 8. Partially-The development of the training package started

iati-activity.title: Third National Communication
iati-activity.description: Preparation of the Third National Communication to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change.

iati-activity.title: Third National Communication
iati-activity.description: To respond to the objectives of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) in accordance with its commitments as a Party to the Convention mandated by Articles 4 and 12 of the UNFCCC and subsequent Conference of Parties (COP) decisions.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Availability of Third National Communication on Climate Change 2. Public outreach on climate change issues

baseline.comment: 1. Second National Communication submitted in 2010 (2010); 2. Lower level of awareness raising on climate change issues (2010)

target.comment: 1.1. National Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Inventory Report for 2010 is finalized and submitted to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). 1.2. Third National Communication is drafted. 1.3. Mitigation and adaptation project proposals formulated 2. Climate change newsletters developed, awareness raising events arranged, project web-page regularly updated.

actual.comment: 1.1. National Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Inventory Report is finalized, printed and submitted to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). 1.2. All the chapters of the Third National Communication (TNC) are finalized. 1.3. Nationally appropriate mitigation actions (NAMA) project on Energy Efficient Public Buildings and Housing in Armenia was finalized and recorded in the NAMA Registry. 2. 2 climate change newsletters developed, educational and awareness raising events organized, thematic calendar for 2015 is published.

target.comment: 1.2. Third National Communication is finalized, published and submitted to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). 1.3. Mitigation and adaptation project proposals formulated. 2. Awareness raising events arranged, project web-page regularly updated.

actual.comment: 1.1. The TNC draft was presented to the Inter-agency Council on climate change. The approved Third National Communication (TNC) was submitted to UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). 1.3. Working group for development of the concept of Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDC) is established. Grid Emission Factor Standardized Baseline of Armenia was calculated and formally submitted to the Clean Development Mechanism (CDM) Executive Board (EB). Project proposal concept on mitigation in residential sector is developed. 2. 5 round tables, 5 press clubs and 26 interviews were organized; 1 film produced.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Percentage of women who run for Local Self-Government (LSG) elections and of those who got elected in target communities vis-a-vis previous electoral cycle 2. Percentage of women, project beneficiaries, who run for local elections and of women who gets elected 3. Number of representatives of local level duty-bearers, civil society and the media trained on gender, democratic governance and social cohesion topics 4. Level of positive change in aftermath of local level initiatives on participatory and gender sensitive governance, including networking, partnerships and joint actions 5. Number of advocacy materials and campaigns on participatory governance and gender issues produced by media outlets 6. Degree of positive shift in presentation and coverage of gender issues in the media identified through Media Monitoring Methodology (2013-2014)

baseline.comment: Representation and meaningful participation of women in decision making is low, only 10.6% are Parliament Members (PMs) (14 out of 131), 10% are Deputy Ministers (6 out of 59), 11% are the Ministers (2 out of 18). There are no female officials among 10 Governors (Marzpets) and there is 1 female Deputy Governor (Deputy Marzpet) among 21. There are no female officials among 48 City Mayors. On average, women constitute about 0.5% of the city council members (Avagani). 2.6% of the village community leaders are females. In average, females constitute less than 7% of the village council members. In total 623 women ran for elections in 2012, of which 406 were elected to local government (from overall 5,384 elected representatives).

target.comment: 1. 10% 2. 30% (running) and 20% (elected) 3. 250 4. The Local Self-Government (LSG) in target communities engage citizens in decision-making over community affairs and bases the decision based on their feedback 5. 5 6. Positive trend in coverage of gender issues in mass media

actual.comment: 1. 11% 2. 32% (running) and 26% (elected) 3. 323 4. Positive trend is noted. All the LSG where Town Hall Meetings were held, based their decisions on the citizens' votes. Two issues are resolved, three are in planning and implementation phase. 5. 5 6. Partial improvement in ensuring gender prism and women issues in coverage of cultural, societal and economic sectors

target.comment: 1. 10% 2. 30% (running) and 20% (elected) 3. 250 4. The Local Self-Government (LSG) in target communities engage citizens in decision-making over community affairs and bases the decision based on their feedback 5. 5

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1.1. Availability of community development plans incorporating climate change risks 1.2. Number of decision makers and community members with increased knowledge on natural resources usage in face of climate change in the framework of the project
2.1. Hectares of forests rehabilitated 2.2. Hectares of pastures rehabilitated 2.3. Percentage of increased carbon storage potential in pilot rehabilitated areas
3. Availability of carbon monitoring programme

baseline.comment:
1.1. Lack of community development plans incorporating climate change risks (2013) 1.2. 0 (2013)
2.1. 0 (2013) 2.2. 0 (2013) 2.2. 0 (2013)
3. Lack of national framework for carbon inventory and monitoring (2013)

target.comment:
1.1. Rapid rural appraisal, as a basis for community development plans incorporating climate change risks, conducted 1.2. 80
2.1. 60 2.2. Not Applicable. Indicator is for 2016 2.3. Not Applicable. Indicator is for 2016
3. Methodology for carbon accounting, as part of carbon monitoring programme, developed.

actual.comment:

2.1. 0 2.2. Not Applicable 2.3. Not Applicable
3. Methodology for carbon accounting, as part of carbon monitoring programme, tested

target.comment:

2.1. 60 2.2. 2000 2.3. Not Applicable. Indicator is for 2016

actual.comment:

indicator.title: Output Indicator

target.comment: 1. Surveys conducted; tailored training materials and specialized training courses (for 2 thematic training courses) are developed. 2. Capacities of national agencies in data processing, analysis and sharing is strengthened, at least three autonomous observation stations for agriculture are provided. 3. 4 pilot projects for most vulnerable rural communities.

actual.comment: 1. 34 surveys, 2 trainings; 10 consultancies 2. 2 automatic weather stations provided, 1 training conducted 3. 5

target.comment: 1. Guidance for climate risk management (CRM) planning is developed. 2. Capacities of national agencies is strengthened. 3. 1 pilot project for most vulnerable rural communities.

actual.comment: 1.1. Climate proofing guide for UNDP Armenia projects is drafted, and 12 recommendations for inclusion of necessary changes are provided for the new format of four-year Community development plans. 2. 1 Regional Crisis Management Center and 911 Call service established, technically equipped. 3. 4

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Percentage of communities in Syunik and Vayots Dzor covered by women empowerment activities 2. Number of representatives of duty-bearers, civil society and the media trained on governance related topics (Reform, policy analysis, gender equality, etc.) 3. Percentage of female beneficiaries assessing capacity development, trainings, mentoring, and opportunities to manifest leadership in action as “useful” and “very useful” 4. Number of knowledge products (manuals, guidelines, white papers, training kits) prepared 5. Number of women (disaggregated by age groups), who run for local self-government elections and the number of women elected in two regions of Armenia 6. Percentage of women of elected women (local council members), who benefited from the project.

baseline.comment: Representation and meaningful participation of women in decision making is low. Only 2.6% of the village community leaders are females. In average, women representation in local self-government is 8.6%. The Territorial Administration Reform implies major community enlargement, which is sensitive and challenging process. The community residents awareness and understanding of the reform is low. The gender dimension of the Reform need enhancement.

location.name: Yerevan
location.activity-description: Disability Certification

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Availability of the new model of disability determination based on the conceptual framework of UNCRPD and ICF developed together with the Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs by mid 2016 2. Number of advocacy and outreach events about the new model of disability determination conducted to inform relevant stakeholders and beneficiaries about the new model

baseline.comment: 1. The current system of disability determination is outdated and based exceptionally on classification becoming a barrier to effective allocation of the existing resources and realization of the rights of persons with disabilities. Development of a new model of disability determination is planned. (2014) 2. There is fragmented or no information with the main stakeholders of the sector and the beneficiaries about the new model (2014)

target.comment: 1. The primary version of the new model of disability determination developed 2. 0

actual.comment: 1. The primary version of the new model of disability determination developed 2. 0

target.comment: 1. The retrospective and prospective testings of the primary version of the new model conducted, results analysed and the model refined 2. 3

actual.comment: 1. The retrospective and prospective testings of the primary version of the new model conducted, results analysed and the model refined 2. 3
